text: i wanted to ask a question because its to do with the essay im currently writing and the question is as a compositor do they give you all the assets needed to complete a shot. For example if you needed to do a sky replacement would they they give you the image of the sky they want you to replace with the original or do you find them yourself.

Yep pretty much. In general other departments create and pass you every asset you need to complete a shot. This is more the case at bigger studios, in your example generally DMP (digital matte painting) would create you a sky or find you one from a library to use and you would comp it. Sometimes you can just find them yourself but often they are built specifically for a shot/sequence. At smaller studios it may be more common to have to find them from libraries yourself as departments are smaller and have less resources
thank you that cleared some confusion up.
Let me know if you need anything else
